knimeNode.name: R Snippet
knimeNode.shortDescription: Allows execution of R commands on an R Server. The result of these R commands is returned in the output table of this node. The final result table will have only one dimension, namely R.

fullDescription.intro:
Allows execution of R commands on an R Server. The entire data (compatible to int, double, and String types) is transfered to the R Server which then executes a series of R commands entered in the dialog. Each column can be accessed by the name provided in the input data table. The output has to be assigned to a variable named R. Missing values are not supported yet.
R installation:
In order to get the R nodes running, you have to install the R-project first, see www.r-project.org. Also the R Server which responds to R commands has to be installed and running, see http://stats.math.uni-augsburg.de/Rserve. Please note that in the current version the R Server needs to be restarted from time to time. If an R node hangs, interrupt the R Server and restart it. Warnings and errors are printed in the R Server window.
fullDescription.option:
Enter R commands here, for instance for computing the Covariance of two columns:
R<-var(cbind(var(Col0,Col1))
The IP of the computer where the R Server is running, for example localhost with IP 127.0.0.1
The login name can be empty.
